All series have similar patterns, SAOZ has more pronounced peaks. Yearly analysis breaks down each period, concluding cyclical patterns with SAOZ peaks higher, Reprobus and Slimcat aligned.

The second text says the graph shows ozone loss from 1990-2020 with peaks around 1998, 2006, 2011, 2020. The three series have similar trends but vary in magnitude, SAOZ higher. Suggests same general pattern but differences due to measurement techniques.

Now, compare the peaks. First text lists 1994, 1997, 2000, 2006, 2011, 2018. Second text mentions 1998, 2006, 2011, 2020. So overlapping peaks are 2006, 2011. But 1994 vs 1998, 2000 vs 2020. These are different years. Also, the first text's highest peaks are 2006 and 2018, while the second mentions 2020 as a peak. Contradicts because 2018 vs 2020. Also, the first text says from 2018 to 2020, decline, but the second text has a peak in 2020. That's conflicting info.

Also, the first text's conclusion mentions SAOZ has more pronounced peaks, Reprobus and Slimcat aligned. The second text says SAOZ generally higher peaks, same general pattern but differences in extent. That part seems similar. But the peak years are conflicting. Since the peak years are different, that's contradictory information. Even if other parts align, the specific years mentioned as peaks don't match. Therefore, the answer should be "no".
</think>
